subject: Using MockitoJUnitRunner.class instead of SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class

messageBody:
I have a question about the usage of SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class. For pure Junits or Unit Test cases should we use Spring based annotations such as @Autowired along with SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class or should we use @RunWith("MockitoJUnitRunner.class") annotation instead with the  at the top of the Test class?


I mean replacing @RunWith(SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class)

@ContextConfiguration({ "classpath:test-applicationContext.xml" }) with just @RunWith(MockitoJUnitRunner.class at the top of the class. It works for me.


My understanding is , In Junits we normally do not make any external calls such as calls to DB or a call to some other web service that are outside of the class that is being tested. We have to mock these external calls using @Mock annotations on this service objects. And then create a real object of the class that we are testing & that depends on these mocks. We can then use @InjectMocks on the real object so that it will be injected with the mocked objects.


Example : Service-A->Calls->Service-B->Calls->Service-C


While testing Service-A we should mock Service B & while testing Service-B we should mock Service-C.           

So, I feel for Unit test cases we need not rely on the dependency injection of the Spring container to provide us the instance of the class we are testing.


Or is it fine to use any one of these techniques to write Junits?


Suggestions please.
